title: 106_s919
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Quinebaug and Shetucket Rivers Valley National Heritage Corridor Reauthorization Act of 1999". References in the Act are considered to be made to the Quinebaug and Shetucket Rivers Valley National Heritage Corridor Act of 1994. SEC. 2. FINDINGS. Section 102 is amended to include the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, redesignate paragraphs, and update references to regional and State agencies. SEC. 3. ESTABLISHMENT OF QUINEBAUG AND SHETUCKET RIVERS VALLEY NATIONAL HERITAGE CORRIDOR; PURPOSE. Section 103 is amended to include the Commonwealth of Massachusetts in the assistance program for the development and implementation of natural and cultural resource management programs for the Quinebaug and Shetucket Rivers Valley. SEC. 4. BOUNDARIES AND ADMINISTRATION. Section 104 is amended to include the towns of Brimfield, Charlton, Dudley, East Brookfield, Holland, Oxford, Southbridge, Sturbridge, and Webster in Massachusetts as part of the Quinebaug and Shetucket Rivers Valley. The Corridor will be managed by Quinebaug-Shetucket Heritage Corridor, Inc., in consultation with the Governors. SEC. 5. MANAGEMENT PLAN. Section 105 is amended to include a new section heading "SEC. 105. MANAGEMENT PLAN." The text chunk discusses amendments to a management plan, including redesignating subsections, implementing the plan by the management entity, and the possibility of grants or loans for plan implementation. The management entity may provide grants or loans to further the goals of the management plan. SEC. 6 amends Section 106 to outline the duties of the Secretary, including providing assistance to the management entity in implementing the management plan. This assistance may include funds and technical support. SEC. 7 amends Section 107 by replacing "Governor" with "management entity." SEC. 8 provides definitions. Section 108 is amended to include the Commonwealth of Massachusetts in various paragraphs, specifying regional planning commissions in Connecticut and Massachusetts. The Commonwealth of Massachusetts is included in Section 108, specifying regional planning commissions in Connecticut and Massachusetts. A management entity, Quinebaug-Shetucket Heritage Corridor, Inc., is defined as a not-for-profit corporation incorporated under Connecticut law. The management plan approved by the Governor of Connecticut on February 16, 1999, titled 'Vision to Reality: A Management Plan', is also defined. SEC. 9. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends Section 109 to authorize appropriations of $1,500,000 for any fiscal year, not exceeding $15,000,000 in total. Federal funding under this title cannot exceed 50% of total assistance costs. 

SEC. 10. CONFORMING AMENDMENT. Amends Section 110 by changing "service" to "system" in the section heading.
